definition: to pull/to draw (a cart or a bow)/to roll up/to coil/to carry on the arm/to lament the dead/(fig.) to pull against/to recover
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: Westpac Bank has recovered all but NZ$3.8 million.
sentences.chinese: 西太平洋銀行僅挽回了380萬新西蘭元的損失。

sentences.english: You keep insisting when you know our love is out the door.
sentences.chinese: 你仍然在堅持當你知道我們的愛已不可挽回。

sentences.english: Christ expiated the sins and propitiated the divine wrath for all his people.
sentences.chinese: 基督替祂的子民贖了他們的罪，並且挽回了神的忿怒。

sentences.english: All the money in the world cannot bring back yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 傾盡世上所有的金錢也無法挽回昨天。

sentences.english: This not only saves face it could save your job!
sentences.chinese: 這不僅能幫你挽回顏面，甚至還能幫你保住工作。

sentences.english: I haven't save your feeling, just facing north say goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 我的挽回你都沒感覺，只是面朝北面說再見。

sentences.english: So maybe during the day, I can rush around and undo the damage.
sentences.chinese: 這樣白天我就可以挽回些損失。

sentences.english: He is the atoning sacrifice for our sins.
Carving your name a thousand times won't bring you back to me.
sentences.chinese: 把你的名字刻上千百遍也無法再將你挽回。

sentences.english: Lead the relationship between back and double grace, specially effort to coax back double grace.
sentences.chinese: 辛勇爲了挽回與雙怡的關係，特地花心思哄回雙怡。

sentences.english: If you leave it too late, there may be nothing left to save.
sentences.chinese: 假如你行動得太晚，局面或許就將無可挽回。

sentences.english: Planting a few ornamental trees does not bring back the loss of forests.
sentences.chinese: 種少量觀賞樹木不能挽回森林的損失。

sentences.english: To the love persistent TongXiaoChun saved the belongs to own love.
sentences.chinese: 對愛情百折不撓的童小春挽回了屬於自己的愛情。

sentences.english: Walk on the streets, the fallen petal flutters lost time not to recover.
sentences.chinese: 走在落花紛飛的街道，逝去的時光無法再挽回。

sentences.english: We must recover our losses somehow.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須以某種方式挽回損失。

sentences.english: At the close of the evening he rallied for a final effort .
sentences.chinese: 晚會結束前，他振作起精神企圖挽回頹勢。

definition: to recover (sth lost or stolen)/to get back
the end/an ending/to wind down/to conclude
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
to persuade/to convince/to talk sb over/Taiwan pr. [shui4 fu2]
